name: Castle Hotel

reviews.title: Worst experience in hotel
reviews.text: Dreadful experience. No free high-speed and the cable is 9.99/noon to noon access. My modem did not work. The rude clerk told me that she didn't have any other guest complaints when I reported the problem. After in-room and telephone assistance I was told I would have to go to the lobby for access. Even lobby access only worked intermittently. Computer problems were reported by several Castle guests attending my conference.

There is one shuttle time for Universal-leave at 10:30 and return at 5:30. They don't tell you this at check-in. So you can go to the park late, leave early or find other transportation which is what we did.
reviews.title: Magical Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There is no complimentary coffee in the lobby. They wanted to charge my husband over $2/cup. The coffee is only available in the morning. In room coffee was not automatically replaced. I had to request additional packets. I guess you are only allocated one packet per stay, even if you are staying eight days, like I did.
reviews.title: Disappointing Castle

likes.disliked: — dreadful piped music and poor shuttle service

reviews.text: I also had to request replacement tissue. The empty box stayed that way until I left a note for the maid. Yes, I was tipping her daily.
reviews.title: Comfortable place to stay - Great location

likes.disliked: — very poor breakfast for their Hilton Honors members, rooms not as nice as I thought they should be.

reviews.text: The air in our room was sucking air from a smoking room so our room air was awful for days. When I mentioned this to the desk, they said they would charge that room $200. That helped resolve my problem how?!?!
reviews.title: Really enjoyed this hotel

likes.disliked: — The bed was not as comfortable as I would have liked.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Friendly staff, great service and fantastic food!
reviews.title: Great atmosphere!

reviews.text: Cosy rooms and a great selection of cocktails from a particular bartender!
reviews.title: Excellent Food and Lovely Atmosphere

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Visited during the Pony and Cobb festival, lively atmosphere in the bar and beautiful food in the restaurant in the evening. Lovely service and atmosphere. Wouod defiantely go again :)
reviews.title: Warm and friendly

reviews.text: Great welcome and friendly service throughout. Definitely return on our next trip.
reviews.title: we loved it and will definatly be returning

reviews.text: Visited the castle for a sunday lunch, received a very warm welcome from the staff who we found to be warm, helpful and friendly. For lunch we all decided on the roast beef which we all found to be truly wonderful, very tasty and melted in the mouth, the vegatables were cooked beautifully with a slight crunch, just how they should be. All in all we all agreed that the food was outstanding and that we would return on our next visit to this beautiful town.
reviews.title: Fab and Friendly

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stopped here recently for a short break. Hotel is very well presented, friendly staff and very clean. Very efficient and friendly check-in.
reviews.title: Friendly welcome, nice hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Room was well decorated, comfy bed and had everything we needed (although hot chocolate and/or biscuits would have been nice on the tea/coffee tray). Only slight issue I had was dish left on table for housekeeping tips. Never come across this before in a hotel and it did make me feel uncomfortable. Did feel obliged to leave a tip each day which personally I was unhappy about, feel that we paid more than enough for the room. Bathroom is excellent, wonderful shower and spotlessly clean.
reviews.title: Nice clean room, pleasant staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We didn't get the room we booked and there was no explanation given. We didn't make a fuss as the room we had was perfectly fine (looking at their website all their standard rooms appear to be the same). We just thought it strange that you are given the option when booking on their website of choosing which room you want and then they give you a different one. Didn't make any difference at all to us (and perhaps the room we were given was quieter) but it is something that people should be aware of.
reviews.title: Good Value Pub Food

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The restaurant was closed on our first night so we decided to eat in The Royal Feathers Hotel which was excellent and had a lovely relaxing bar area. It was so good that we ate there the other nights as well so can't comment on the food at the Castle. We also preferred to stop in the Royal Feathers bar area for a drink afterwards as the Castle bar can be very noisy and we preferred a more relaxing atmosphere.
reviews.title: evening meal

reviews.text: The hotel is situated on the corner of what can be two quite busy roads and we hadn't appreciated just how much traffic passes through Aberaeron (ear plugs useful on a night). We parked on the public car park (free) overnight. It was impossible to get a space when returning on an afternoon so we parked further down the road by the sea front and then moved the car on a night when we were leaving to go for a meal, by which time it was easy to find a space.
reviews.title: Well located friendly hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My booking was made by internet on the day before we arrived and there was a indeed a record of it when we arrived. Friendly welcome from the chap behind the bar.
reviews.title: A friendly welcome and decent breakfast

reviews.text: The room was on the second floor - not good if you don't like stairs. I found the room a bit cramped and as it was on the corner had traffic noise on two sides. The bathroom was well appointed with a very decent shower.
reviews.title: A warm welsh welcome

reviews.text: We only ate breakfast at the Castle, having decided to try a couple of different restaurants in the town. The waitress was pleasantly chatty and the breakfasts set us up well for the days ahead.The bar did however, offer a decent drop of beer!
reviews.title: Welcoming staff and Great atmosphere!

reviews.text: A very warm welcome at this hotel by the owner . Comfortable room with shower ensuite . Food in restaurant very nice and cooked fresh. Good cooked breakfast . An enjoyable night spent here with friends and would go back . Very lively saturday night in the bar - end of season rugby match just been played - so not as quiet as it would be otherwise , but great fun nevertheless !
reviews.title: Quality room. Friendly staff.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just back from a night at this hotel - advertised as cycle friendly as we had cycled there and they locked our bikes away for us. The welcome was great and the landlady very chatty. We (7 of us) had dinner in the lovely restaurant- nothing was too much trouble and the food fantastic. The bar downstairs was lively to say the least, but again, most welcoming! The rooms were comfortable and the power shower excellent. I would give it 5 stars as although we did not hear any of the noise downstairs/outside, our friends did.... but.they said they were light sleepers. I would thoroughly recommend the hotel.
reviews.title: wonderful stay and great singing
Great Stay
reviews.text: We recently stayed at the Doubletree for 3 nights from July 31st until August 2nd. My girls loved the hotel especially the glass doors in the elevator and the pool. We didn't eat at the hotel because the prices were a little bit more than we were used to paying. Our room was clean and ready when we checked in which took no time at all. One night when we came back from supper we couldn't find a parking place and when I went in to see where they would like for me to park the manager on duty came out and moved his car so we could have his space. Very impressive. We would stay here again. The only thing I would change is if upon check in parents were informed about the charges for the games and such on the T.V. because sometimes little hands are faster than we realize.

reviews.title: If the price is right.....
reviews.text: This hotel was nice compared to many of the hotels in the area. The room was very nice, comfortable beds and a great theme to the hotel! The main problem with this hotel is there are no food choices. they charge 10 bucks in the morning for a continental/warm breakfast that to me was silly because all of the other hotels in the area had complimentary breakfast. It was a definite drawback to pay 2.50 for a small yogurt. Orlando is a very expensive city and it would be nice to have a hotel that helped with the breakfast. But onto other things. The room was great, it was comfortable and we had a great view from our room. On the 4th of July we went to the roof and watched all of the fireworks at all of the theme parks. Which you can do every night because there are fireworks no matter if there is a holiday!

reviews.title: Wonderful
reviews.text: It was a great hotel for under a hundred bucks, if you are spending more than that, find somewhere else.......

reviews.title: Fantastic Stay
reviews.text: We were there the weekend before the 4th of July. We arrived late and tired, no problem, check in took moments. We were on the 8th floor (requested high floor), great views fo surrounding restaurants and activities. Hotel was very clean, decorated in a "castle" style, adequate lighting in room and bathroom. The beds were very comfortable. We enjoyed the swimming pool very much however it could have been a little warmer. We did not use the breakfast area. We did have dinner at Vito's Chop House, one of two attached restaurants, it was a little pricy but the food was delicious and service was very elegant. Trolley stop for Sea World is right across the street but I would not recommend it. We rode it one time to Sea World and it was very, very crowded and the wait at Sea World to come back was approximately one hour. One hour seems like forever when you are hot, tired and hungry. We would stay here again.

reviews.title: Felt like a queen
reviews.text: We stayed here for 10 nights and we had a wonderful experience! The rooms were very nice and clean, were large enough to not feel cramped with four people, and we had a spectacular veiw of the pool area. It was also very quiet, during our stay I think we saw one other person on our floor besides housekeeping. All the staff we encountered were friendly and kind. The pool was never crowded, most of the times were the only ones swimming, everyone else just sat around the outside. The pool was not heated any when we were there. You wouldn't think it would need to be on 90+ degree days, but that water was freezing, especially at night!

I stayed at the Doubletree Castle for seven nights and really enjoyed my time. I was there for a convention, so being close to the convention centre and restaurants was important. The rooms were very clean and well serviced. The beds were comfortable and the staff were pleasant. The internet speeds were great, so doing business was a dream. I'm hopefully heading back there again in Dec 07 and I'll certainly stay there again!
reviews.title: Great Hotel - Great Value

reviews.text: The Castle hotel was a great wow factor for the kids and was very easy for us to find, right on I-Drive.
reviews.title: MouseTastic!

likes.liked: — The whole castle thing is great inside and out, very easy to navigate from

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very helpful friendly staff and rooms were kept immaculate.
reviews.title: Fantastic!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would recommend this hotel to anyone not staying inside the theme parks.
reviews.title: Doubletree Dungeon ....
Not what I expected
reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights in October 2006 and it was fab! On check we received info regarding the free shuttle service and 2 hot choc chip cookies.

I stayed at this property recently for business purposes (not my selection). It seemed odd to be holding business meetings at a hotel shaped like a castle, and I had concerns about trying to conduct business at a hotel full of LOTS of children. As it turns out, those fears were largely unfounded, and the dynamic was even more odd: a bunch of adults there on business (many attending a large convention) at a hotel that seemed specifically designed to cater to families of small children.
reviews.title: Quirky, nice

likes.liked: — A little too themey for me, not really a business hotel.

reviews.text: The "baking cookie" smell bombards you as you walk in the door, and the lobby area is decorated with creatures big and small, along with other castle-themed items.
reviews.title: Much Better than many reviews stated!

likes.disliked: — Air conditioner took a while to cool the room.

reviews.text: The room was fine, with a bit of kitschy castle-themed decor, but nothing too outrageous. After the first day I tuned out the jeweled mirror and it felt like any other hotel room. Overall the rooms were fine, beds were nice. Neutrogena amenities in the bathroom.
reviews.title: More like a peasant hovel than a castle

reviews.text: The pool area was nice, with a bar/patio overlooking it. What I liked was that the pool area wasn't huge, and had nice landscaping. It seemed more tropical and intimate than vast and barren - as many of the local hotels seem to be.
reviews.title: Unique decor
nasty dirty sheets
reviews.text: It's in a good location on I-Drive, with many chain restaurants within walking distance. Cafe Tu Tu Tango is at the hotel, along with another restaurant (steak or Italian, I'm not sure - didn't go there).

I stayed at the castle during the begining of October thoroughly enjoyed my stay, my first impressions which are most important was that it was a warm and welcomming atmosphere with friendly staff ready to help you any moment, my room was nice and spacious with all the nessecary facilities the clenliness of the room was to an exceedingly high standard, after checking into my room I went for a meal in the resturant the food was esquisit along with the service and the waiting time the atmosphere of the resturant itself was calm and relaxing, the clenliness of the resturant was again to a high standard I could find no fault. Overall my stay at the castle was one of the best experiences I have had and would recomend this hotel to my friends and family.
reviews.title: Outstanding stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great hotel, lovely bar, cosy rooms, excellent location. We were given a very warm welcome by the proprietors. Highly recommended. Would certainly return
reviews.title: great hotel, cosy rooms, excellent location, lovely atmosphere and a very warm welcome

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Croeso cynnes iawn. Gwesty hyfryd gyda popeth chi eisiau, ystafell wely neis iawn, bwyd hyfryd, awyrgylch croesawgar, cyfleusterau modern a moethus
reviews.title: clean newly decorated

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: MP Caerydd
reviews.title: A honest review
Great hotel, great breakfast, and great welcome!
reviews.text: great welcome when we arrived, room small and basic, brecfast very good, staff very pleasant throughout stay.

aka: Holiday Inn Resort Orlando - The Castle Hotel Orlando
description: Discover the newest work of art from The Kessler Collection. An enriching experience awaits at the Castle Hotel, located in the heart of Orlando’s attractions. Leisure guests, business travelers, and those seeking a distinctive venue for a wedding or social event will find a sophisticated and contemporary retreat in the only Autograph Collection Hotel on International Drive. The Four-Diamond Castle Hotel immerses guests in art, music, cuisine and culture within its Bavarian-inspired walls, providing an oasis to travelers with uncommon taste. Evoking an air of creativity and artistry, the Castle Hotel offers elegant accommodations and amenities, inspired meeting space, gourmet cuisine and intuitive service.
